result.execSummary:
The defendant Radames Colon Acosta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Radames Colon Acosta is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Radames Colon Acosta was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Radames Colon Acosta was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
7-19-2016 Court extends probation for defendant to complete Anger Managment
Concurrent with: with count #2

miscConds.notes: Upon successfull completion of probation the defendant may petition the court for expungment under 973.015 youthful offender.

Defendant to undergo Anger Management Counseling. 
Defendant to pay court costs, crime victim witness surcharge and supervision fees through probation as determined by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.

May be served in Rock County if Sheriffs agree.
Concurrent with: any other count

ADDRESS INFO for Radames Colon Acosta
Current: rums,   (Effective: 02-13-2017)
Prior: 200 US Hwy 14, C/O Rock County Jail, Janesville, WI 53545

Radames  Colon Acosta, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Jason D Sanders.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant has been diagnosed as bipolar, typically a hard worker when medicated. Joint recommendation is for 90 days jail time with Huber on count 1, and 7 months jail time with Huber on count 2, to be served concurrently to each other. 63 days statutory sentence credit, may be served in Rock County Jail if Sheriffs agree. Victim Witness surcharges, court costs, etc. in the total amount of $950.30 to be converted to a civil judgment in favor of the state and against the defendant.
to transport
Atty. Jason Sanders
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
